list.name: Big Boobed Waitress
list.about: The Big Boobed Waitress is a minor character from Rick and Morty who works at a restaurant. Her exaggerated physical attributes are a satirical take on the objectification of women in popular media. Rick and Morty often uses absurdity and caricature to comment on societal norms, and the inclusion of the Big Boobed Waitress serves as a critique of the male gaze and traditional gender roles.

list.name: Big Head Morty
list.about: Big Head Morty, as the name suggests, is a Morty with an unusually large head compared to other Mortys in the series Rick and Morty. This character's design is reminiscent of the 'Bobblehead' toys, known for their oversized heads. Big Head Morty's appearance is a playful exaggeration that adds visual variety to the diverse range of Morty variations encountered throughout the show.

list.name: Big Morty
list.about: Big Morty is a giant version of Morty who appears in the episode 'Big Trouble in Little Sanchez' of Rick and Morty. This character's massive size is a result of a growth hormone experiment gone wrong. Big Morty's presence highlights the show's exploration of scientific mishaps and the consequences of tampering with reality and natural order within the Rick and Morty multiverse.

list.name: Body Guard Morty
list.about: Body Guard Morty, also known as One Eye Open Morty, is a Morty variant who takes his role as a bodyguard very seriously. He wears an eye patch and is often seen protecting high-profile characters. Body Guard Morty's character parodies the archetypal 'tough guy' bodyguard trope found in various action movies and adds an element of humor and irony to the show.

list.name: Bill
list.about: Bill is a common name and appears as a generic character in the show Rick and Morty. The character named Bill serves as a representation of ordinary individuals in the Rick and Morty multiverse. By using a common name, the show emphasizes the contrast between the extraordinary adventures of the main characters and the mundane existence of regular people, creating a sense of relatability and comedic effect.

list.name: Bill
list.about: Bill, another character with the same name, appears as a generic character in the show Rick and Morty. The repetition of the name Bill underscores the show's tendency to use common names to represent average individuals within the vast and diverse multiverse. The recurrence of generic characters adds a touch of surrealism and humor, highlighting the show's exploration of absurdity.

list.name: Birdperson
list.about: Birdperson, also known as Phoenixperson after his resurrection, is a close friend of Rick Sanchez in the series Rick and Morty. Birdperson's design and characteristics are inspired by bird-like humanoid creatures commonly found in science fiction and fantasy genres. The character's name and appearance playfully reference the archetype of bird-like creatures often depicted in mythology and popular culture.

list.name: Black Rick
list.about: Black Rick, also known as 'Tall Morty' or 'Doofus Rick,' is a version of Rick Sanchez who is physically identical to the main Rick but has a darker skin tone. This character highlights the concept of infinite possibilities and variations within the Rick and Morty multiverse. Black Rick's existence challenges traditional notions of identity and reinforces the show's exploration of parallel dimensions and alternate selves.

list.name: Blamph
list.about: Blamph is a fictional character from Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'Get Schwifty.' Blamph is a giant floating head from the Cromulon dimension that communicates with Earth through catchy songs and demands a musical performance. The inclusion of Blamph is a satirical commentary on reality TV shows and the absurd demands placed on contestants for entertainment purposes.

list.name: Blim Blam
list.about: Blim Blam is an extraterrestrial character from the episode 'Mortynight Run' of Rick and Morty. Blim Blam is known as a 'glorzo' and possesses the ability to manipulate people's memories. The character's design and abilities are reminiscent of classic science fiction tropes related to mind control and manipulation. Blim Blam's presence adds an element of mystery and intrigue to the show's interdimensional escapades.

list.name: Blue Diplomat
list.about: The Blue Diplomat is a minor character from Rick and Morty who represents an alien species involved in diplomatic negotiations. The character's blue appearance is a playful nod to the classic science fiction trope of depicting extraterrestrial beings with unconventional skin colors. The inclusion of the Blue Diplomat adds visual diversity and reinforces the show's exploration of intergalactic politics and cultural interactions.

list.name: Blue Footprint Guy
list.about: Blue Footprint Guy is a background character from Rick and Morty who appears in various episodes. He is characterized by his distinctive blue footprints left wherever he goes. Blue Footprint Guy's recurring presence serves as an inside joke and running gag within the show. His unexplained footprints add an element of intrigue and whimsy to the background details of the Rick and Morty universe.

list.name: Blue Shirt Morty
list.about: Blue Shirt Morty is a version of Morty Smith who sports a blue shirt instead of the usual yellow one. While the change in clothing may seem insignificant, it showcases the show's attention to detail and the existence of countless variations of Morty across the multiverse. Blue Shirt Morty's appearance serves as a reminder of the infinite possibilities and subtle differences among the many Morty iterations encountered in the show.

list.name: Bobby Moynihan
list.about: Bobby Moynihan is an American comedian and actor known for his work on the sketch comedy show 'Saturday Night Live.' In Rick and Morty, Bobby Moynihan lends his voice to various characters, adding his comedic talent to the series. Moynihan's versatile voice acting contributes to the diverse and memorable cast of characters that populate the vibrant and often absurd world of Rick and Morty.

list.name: Boobloosian
list.about: The Boobloosians are a fictional alien species encountered in the episode 'The Whirly Dirly Conspiracy' of Rick and Morty. They are characterized by their distinctive appearance, with multiple eyes and a blob-like body. The name 'Boobloosian' is a playful combination of the words 'boob' and 'alien.' The inclusion of the Boobloosians adds to the show's repertoire of unique and bizarre extraterrestrial creatures.

list.name: Bootleg Portal Chemist Rick
list.about: Bootleg Portal Chemist Rick is a version of Rick Sanchez who operates as an underground portal chemist. He provides unauthorized and low-quality portal devices to individuals seeking interdimensional travel. Bootleg Portal Chemist Rick's character reflects the darker and seedier side of the Rick and Morty multiverse, where illicit activities thrive amidst the backdrop of infinite possibilities and moral ambiguity.

list.name: Borpocian
list.about: Borpocians are a fictional alien species in Rick and Morty known for their distinctive blue skin and long snouts. They are featured in the episode 'The Rickchurian Mortydate.' The name 'Borpocian' is likely a playful combination of words without any specific reference. Their inclusion adds to the show's imaginative and diverse range of extraterrestrial civilizations that exist within the vastness of the multiverse.

list.name: Brad
list.about: Brad is a common name and appears as a generic character in the show Rick and Morty. The character named Brad represents an average individual within the multiverse, often caught up in the chaotic adventures of the main characters. By using a common name, the show highlights the contrast between the extraordinary events and the ordinary lives that sometimes get entangled in the grander narrative.

list.name: Brad Anderson
list.about: Brad Anderson is a fictional character from the episode 'Auto Erotic Assimilation' of Rick and Morty. He is an old acquaintance of Rick Sanchez, with whom he shares a tumultuous history. Brad Anderson's character serves as a representation of the complex relationships and unresolved conflicts that exist within Rick's past. His inclusion adds depth to Rick's backstory and further explores the consequences of Rick's actions.

list.name: Calypso
list.about: Calypso is a character from the episode 'The Old Man and the Seat' of Rick and Morty. He is an alien entity with the ability to create complex simulations and virtual realities. Calypso's name is a reference to the nymph Calypso from Greek mythology, known for her association with isolation and temptation. The inclusion of Calypso adds a layer of philosophical contemplation and existential themes to the show's narrative.
